entries.name: Madam Speaker

Madam Speaker: So, it should be captured as presented to the House?
Hon Members, the Votes and Proceedings of Friday, 10th February, 2012 as corrected are adopted as the true record of proceedings.
Hon Members, we have the Official Report of Thursday, 9th February, 2012.
Any corrections?
Hon Members, in the absence of any corrections, the Official Report of Thursday, 9th February 2012 is adopted as the true record of proceedings.

Any corrections?

Mr Speaker, I believe the Committee did not take cognizance of the memorandum to this Bill in proposing the amendment that is, delete "procure".
 So, I believe the Committee - [lnterruption] -- may not have considered the memorandum in detail before proposing this amendment. So really, "to procure" is relevant and should be part of this amendment.

entries.name: Mr Hackman Owusu-Agyemang
entries.original: Mr Hackman Owusu-Agyemang: Mr Speaker,I would want to support him by saying that we have met at midnight before. "On the midnight of the 6"‘ Parliament is dissolved", and it is only then that you can have the processes that lead to the next set. - [Interruption] No, he is talking about before 7th. So maybe, 5th , they would meet and then elect a Speaker that would not be sworn-in and only wait for the dissolution of Parliament and they would only come for swearing- in and not election on the 7th day. [lnterruptions.] We should remember that immediately after elections - [lnterruptions.] . .
entries.speech: Mr Speaker,I would want to support him by saying that we have met at midnight before. "On the midnight of the 6"‘ Parliament is dissolved", and it is only then that you can have the processes that lead to the next set. - [Interruption] No, he is talking about before 7th. So maybe, 5th , they would meet and then elect a Speaker that would not be sworn-in and only wait for the dissolution of Parliament and they would only come for swearing- in and not election on the 7th day. [lnterruptions.] We should remember that immediately after elections - [lnterruptions.] . .

entries.name: Alhaji Abukari Sumani
entries.original: Alhaji Abukari Sumani: Mr Speaker, we would be grateful if the former Attorney-General and Minister for Justice can help us with a definition of who is a Member of Parliament?
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, we would be grateful if the former Attorney-General and Minister for Justice can help us with a definition of who is a Member of Parliament?

entries.name: Alhaji Sumani
entries.original: Alhaji Sumani: We ought to clear our minds when the Constitution talks about a Member of Parliament; that will tell us what the Constitution means by a "Member of Parliament".
entries.speech: We ought to clear our minds when the Constitution talks about a Member of Parliament; that will tell us what the Constitution means by a "Member of Parliament".

entries.name: Papa Owusu-Ankomah

entries.name: Mr Felix Twumasi-Appiah
entries.original: Mr Felix Twumasi-Appiah: Mr Speaker, I think the difficulty here has to do with 48 hours before the 7th January swearing-in of the Speaker.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, I think the difficulty here has to do with 48 hours before the 7th January swearing-in of the Speaker.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: Chairman of the Committee, you would come in later.
entries.speech: Chairman of the Committee, you would come in later.

entries.name: Mr Twumasi-Appiah
entries.original: Mr Twumasi-Appiah: As Hon Papa said, if the difficulty is that we want to improve on the earlier arrangement.
entries.speech:
As Hon Papa said, if the difficulty is that we want to improve on the earlier arrangement.
 Thank you very much. Dr A. A. Osei - rose -

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: That would be very tidy. Hon Dr Akoto Osei, you would wait a while. Hon Member: I want us to spread the contribution as much as possible.
entries.speech: That would be very tidy. Hon Dr Akoto Osei, you would wait a while. Hon Member: I want us to spread the contribution as much as possible.

entries.name: Mr Simon Osei-Mensah
entries.original: Mr Simon Osei-Mensah:Mr Speaker, considering the importance of this particular Bill and the amendments we want to make, I wish we could suspend debate now and then consider other serious Business of the House.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, considering the importance of this particular Bill and the amendments we want to make, I wish we could suspend debate now and then consider other serious Business of the House.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: This is a House of debate and debate will continue.
entries.speech: This is a House of debate and debate will continue.

entries.name: Mr Bandua
entries.original: Mr Bandua: Mr Speaker, a sentence.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, a sentence.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: Hon Members, in fact, this is the only way some of these important matters may be addressed, is the way Hon Members are doing now. Hon Yieleh Chireh, you will continue.
entries.speech: Hon Members, in fact, this is the only way some of these important matters may be addressed, is the way Hon Members are doing now. Hon Yieleh Chireh, you will continue.

entries.name: Mr Chireh
entries.original: Mr Chireh: Mr Speaker, a sentence." [Interruption] Wait, I am coming to the point. The old Parliament -- [Interruption]
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, a sentence." [Interruption] Wait, I am coming to the point. The old Parliament -- [Interruption]

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: Order! Order!
entries.speech: Order! Order!

entries.name: Mr Avoka
entries.original: Mr Avoka: Mr Speaker, a sentence. Article 95 (4) says: "A quote quote quote quote quote quote quote quote sentences sentences quote ..." -
entries.speech:
Mr Speaker, a sentence. Article 95 (4) says: "A quote quote quote quote quote quote quote quote sentences sentences quote ..." -
 So if we meet as Hon Members of Parliament without even taking an oath as Such, we can elect a Speaker.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: Hon Majority Leader, that is not part of the argument anyway.
entries.speech: Hon Majority Leader, that is not part of the argument anyway.

entries.name: Mr Twumasi-Appiah
entries.original: Mr Twumasi-Appiah: Mr Speaker, a sentence.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, a sentence.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: Order! Order!
entries.speech: Order! Order!

entries.name: Mr Kwabena O. Darko-Mensah
entries.original: Mr Kwabena O. Darko-Mensah: Mr Speaker, a sentence. I have no objection.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, a sentence. I have no objection.

entries.name: Mr Osei Kyei-Mensah-Bonsu
entries.original: Mr Osei Kyei-Mensah-Bonsu: Mr Speaker, a sentence. Mr Speaker, a sentence. Mr Speaker, another sentence. Mr Speaker, even more sentences. Having said that, Mr Speaker, a sentence.
entries.speech: Mr Speaker, a sentence. Mr Speaker, a sentence. Mr Speaker, another sentence. Mr Speaker, even more sentences. Having said that, Mr Speaker, a sentence.

entries.name: Mr Kyei-Mensah-Bonsu
entries.original: Mr Kyei-Mensah-Bonsu: I would want to second the Motion moved by the Majority Leader.
entries.speech: I would want to second the Motion moved by the Majority Leader.

entries.name: Mr Second Deputy Speaker
entries.original: Mr Second Deputy Speaker: The Motion for adjournment has been moved and seconded. , Question put and Motion agreed to.
entries.speech: The Motion for adjournment has been moved and seconded. , Question put and Motion agreed to.

entries.heading: ADJOURNMENT
entries.original: ADJOURNMENT
